intro: Pedicularis pontica, commonly known as the Pontic lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its vivid, spurred flowers that range in color from red to yellow, often resembling the appearance of a louse. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in high-altitude flora.
